avalancheActivity.comment:
Over a wide area 25 to 40 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell yesterday above approximately 1800 m.
The fresh snow and the sometimes large wind slabs formed by the easterly wind are poorly bonded with the old snowpack in some places in particular on steep sunny slopes and at intermediate and high altitudes. These can be released, even by a single winter sport participant and reach large size in isolated cases.
The current avalanche situation calls for caution and restraint, caution is to be exercised in particular on steep slopes, and on wind-loaded slopes.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The new snow and wind slabs can be released easily, even by a single winter sport participant,.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The fresh snow as well as the wind slabs are bonding poorly with the old snowpack in some places in particular on steep sunny slopes.
Towards its surface, the snowpack is dry; its surface consists of loosely bonded snow.
Weak layers exist in the old snowpack in particular on shady slopes.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Over a wide area 30 to 40 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell yesterday above approximately 1800 m.
The fresh snow and the wind slabs formed by the northeasterly wind are poorly bonded with the old snowpack in some places in particular on steep sunny slopes and at low and intermediate altitudes. These can be released, even by a single winter sport participant and reach medium size.
Steep slopes are to be evaluated with care and prudence. The avalanches can occur even at intermediate altitudes.

In particular on very steep sunny slopes and in starting zones where no previous releases have taken place small and medium-sized gliding avalanches and moist snow slides are possible as a consequence of warming during the day.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The new snow and wind slabs of yesterday must be evaluated with care and prudence.

snowpackStructure.comment:
As a consequence of northeasterly wind, soft wind slabs formed. The large quantity of fresh snow as well as the wind slabs are bonding poorly with the old snowpack in some places in particular on steep sunny slopes.
The upper section of the snowpack is dry; its surface consists of loosely bonded snow. The solar radiation will give rise as the day progresses to increasing consolidation of the snowpack in particular on steep sunny slopes. This situation will give rise to moistening of the snowpack at low altitude.

avalancheActivity.comment:
In some regions 15 to 20 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell yesterday above approximately 2000 m. As a consequence of new snow and southeasterly wind, sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs formed. These can in some places be released by a single winter sport participant and reach medium size. This applies in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain, as well as on wind-loaded slopes at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.

The current avalanche situation calls for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger and careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wind slabs require caution.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area 15 to 20 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell yesterday above approximately 2000 m.
As a consequence of new snow and wind from easterly directions, sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs formed in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls as well as at elevated altitudes. The new snow is bonding only slowly with the old snowpack especially on steep sunny slopes and at intermediate altitudes.

avalancheActivity.comment:
5 to 15 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell yesterday above approximately 2000 m.
The fresh and older wind slabs are covered with new snow and therefore difficult to recognise. The fresh and older wind slabs can be released, especially by large additional loads,. Caution is to be exercised adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions, as well as on wind-loaded slopes. In some places avalanches can be triggered in the old snowpack, especially on steep shady slopes.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The fresh and older wind slabs are covered with new snow and therefore difficult to recognise.

snowpackStructure.comment:
5 to 15 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell yesterday above approximately 2000 m.
As a consequence of a sometimes moderate southwesterly wind, rather small wind slabs formed adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls as well as in high Alpine regions.
Low and intermediate altitudes sunny slopes: As a consequence of mild temperatures and solar radiation the snowpack consolidated during the last few days.

avalancheActivity.comment:
10 to 20 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell yesterday above approximately 1800 m.

As a consequence of wind from northeasterly directions, soft wind slabs formed. They are lying on a crust in particular on steep sunny slopes and at low and intermediate altitudes. The soft wind slabs are easy to recognise and can be released by large loads in particular.
The solar radiation will give rise as the day progresses to increasing consolidation of the snowpack in particular on steep sunny slopes. This situation will give rise to moistening of the snowpack at low altitude.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wind slabs require caution, in the regions exposed to snowfall in particular on very steep slopes.

snowpackStructure.comment:
10 to 20 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell yesterday above approximately 1800 m.
As a consequence of wind from northeasterly directions, soft wind slabs formed. They are lying on a crust in particular on steep sunny slopes and at low and intermediate altitudes. The solar radiation will give rise as the day progresses to increasing consolidation of the snowpack in particular on steep sunny slopes. This situation will give rise to moistening of the snowpack at low altitude.
